headline.main: In France A College For Elderly Students

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IT was early October, and the opening of school - or as the French call it, the rentree - was in high gear.
docs.snippet: LEAD: IT was early October, and the opening of school - or as the French call it, the rentree - was in high gear.

headline.main: The Cost of Drug Abuse: $60 Billion a Year

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Economists say the cost of illicit drugs to American society has risen substantially in the last few years, to far more than $60 billion annually. At the same time they are discovering vast new areas of additional economic impact that they are only now beginning to understand.

headline.main: Ailing Agency - The F.D.A. and Safety; A Guardian of U.S. Health Is Buckling Under Stress

byline.original: By PHILIP J. HILTS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Food and Drug Administration, the Federal agency responsible for insuring the safety of food, drugs, cosmetics and medical devices, is facing rising responsibilities with a smaller staff and a budget that has remained almost constant for a decade.

byline.original: By JANET PIORKO; JANET PIORKO is an editor in the Travel section

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IT was barely noon of my first full day at Palm-Aire Spa, and I had already exercised more than I would have in a week at home: a two-mile walk at 7 A.M., a workout in the pool at 9, a toning class at 10 and aerobics at 11. This was the general pattern of my visit last month to two Florida spas: In the morning I worked, and in the afternoon
